meanings.definition: A period of time equal to one twelfth of a year.
meanings.sent1: She waited for many meses to see her favorite band in concert.
meanings.sent2: The baby will start walking in a few meses.
meanings.sent3: After many meses of practice, he finally mastered the guitar.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's patience lasted for meses as she guided her students.
meanings.sent5: The meses of winter seemed to drag on endlessly.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'mes', meaning month in Spanish.
meanings.sent1: They celebrated their birthdays in different meses of the year.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people fast during certain meses.
meanings.sent3: The kittens were born in separate meses, making it hard to keep track of their ages.
meanings.sent4: The colorful leaves fell in a cascade of diferentes meses.
meanings.sent5: The farmer planted different crops in various meses to ensure a year-round harvest.
